solution_line_template: There are {total_curlers} curlers in all and   c of them are pink or {total_curlers} curlers / {pink_curler_denominator} = <<{total_curlers}/{pink_curler_denominator}={pink_curlers}>>{pink_curlers} pink curlers.

There are twice as many blue curlers as there are pink ones, so there are {pink_curlers} pink x {blue_curler_multiplier} = <<{pink_curlers}*{blue_curler_multiplier}={blue_curlers}>>{blue_curlers} blue curlers.

Together, there are {pink_curlers} pink curlers + {blue_curlers} blue curlers = <<{pink_curlers}+{blue_curlers}={total_pink_and_blue_curlers}>>{total_pink_and_blue_curlers} pink and blue curlers in Erin's hair.

The remaining curlers are green, so of the {total_curlers} total curlers - {total_pink_and_blue_curlers} pink and blue curlers = <<{total_curlers}-{total_pink_and_blue_curlers}={green_curlers}>>{green_curlers} green curlers are in Erin's hair.
